page.title: 15Two Local Shows.
page.content: The{Unst Pony Breeders Association holds its annual show every other year at the Show Park in Baltasound - the alternate year it is held in Haroldswick. Sheep were added to the show about 5 years ago, and pets were added last year to create an interest for youngsters. Pony numbers are steady at around 60 - 70 with all classes at the shows well-filled, but the introduction of sheep probably saved the show.Prizes are given either in cash or trophies and there are about 8 trophies for ponies and sheep. Judges are invited from outwith Shetland if possible. The show is held at the end of August/early September along with the{S.W.R.I. Gala}which is in the local hall with a display of crafts,knitwear,vegetables,flowers and baking with prizes.A concert followed by a dance is held in the evening.
